dt: {bc}to color with a slight shade or stain {bc}{sx|tint||}
{bc}to affect or modify with a slight odor or taste

et: Latin {it}tingere{/it} to dip, moisten, tinge; akin to Greek {it}tengein{/it} to moisten and probably to Old High German {it}dunkōn{/it} to dip
shortdef: to color with a slight shade or stain : tint
to affect or modify with a slight odor or taste
to affect or modify in character

dt: {bc}a high-pitched sound like that made by a light stroke on a crystal goblet

et: {it}ting{/it}, verb, from Middle English {it}tingen{/it}, of imitative origin
shortdef: a high-pitched sound like that made by a light stroke on a crystal goblet
